source.a5c4c25c:
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
x = x.values.reshape(15, 1)
y = y.values
x_train, x_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(x, y,test_size = 0.2, random_state = 0)
source.58a30f6a:
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
linear_reg = LinearRegression()
linear_reg.fit(x_train, y_train)
y_pred = linear_reg.predict(x_test)
source.d7f57c44:
plt.scatter(x_train, y_train, color = 'red')
plt.plot(x_train, linear_reg.predict(x_train))
plt.xlabel('Height')
plt.ylabel('Weight')
plt.title('Height vs Weight')
plt.show()

source.bf095b15:
There are 2 columns, height and weight.  
Also there are 15 entries. Since this dataset is not that big, it can be clearly seen that there is not any null value.  
But still, we will see this with code below.
source.1db62dea: # Taking Care of Missing Data ### Check whether there is null entry or not. .notnull() returns True or False for each row. .all() checks whether all of them is True.
